result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gage Richard Burdick

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:32 PM Defendant Gage Richard Burdick appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Address updated. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Court orders Signature bond in the amount of $1,000 to be signed by November 4, 2022 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim C.B., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May not own or possess any firearms. Court orders Defendant to contact Public Defender's Office or private attorney. Adjourned initial appearance set for November 16, 2022 at 1:00 PM
No contact directly or indirectly with victim CB, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May not possess any weapons or firearms.
